entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Case against BJP's Parvesh Verma for distributing shoes to Delhi votersParvesh Verma, who has been fielded against Arvind Kejriwal on New Delhi seat, has been accused of violating the Model Code of Conduct.

Inadvertent error: Meta apologises for Mark Zuckerberg's 2024 poll loss remarkMeta apology: The apology by Meta India comes a day after BJP MP Nishikant Dubey, who heads the parliamentary panel on IT, said it would summon the company's officials over Zuckerberg's remark.

Add Galwan, Siachen to holiday plan. India is opening battle tourism bunkerNow, tourists can add historical battleground sites of the Indian armed forces to their list of travel destinations. The Indian Army, in association with the Ministry of Tourism, is launching Bharat Ranbhoomi Darshan, and would open up 77 battleground spots, including those in Siachen, Kargil and Galwan.

Missing 'crorepati' constable, his diary spark Congress vs BJP row in BhopalThe saga, which started with raids by Lokayukta on a former government official and subsequent seizure of Rs 11 crore cash and 52 kg of gold from an abandoned vehicle, has now taken a political turn.

'Stupidity': Pak PM orders probe after Pak airline's Paris flight ad backfiresIt has been a PR disaster for Pakistan International Airlines after its ad celebrating the resumption of its European flights featured an image of an aircraft seemingly heading towards the Eiffel Tower.

Denied fuel for not wearing helmet, lineman snaps power supply at UP petrol pumpOn Tuesday, apetrol pump attendant refused to refuel the bike of the lineman as part of the government's 'no helmet, no petrol' diktat.

Rahul Gandhi stirs up storm with 'fighting Indian state' remark, faces BJP fireRahul Gandhi stirred a row after asserting that BJP and RSS had captured all institutions of the country and the Congress was now fighting the 'Indian state itself' apart from the two organisations.

Amul stares at bread daily: Dairy brand shares doodle on L&T Chairman's remarksDuring an interaction with his employees last week, L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan had defended L&T's six-day work week policy.

How RSS has impacted vastu of new Congress headquartersAfter five decades at 24, Akbar Road, the Congress has moved to a new headquarters, Indira Bhawan, a kilometre from the BJP head office at Deen Dayal Upadhyay Marg. Wary of having an office on a road named after the long-dead RSS ideologue, the Congress is using its back door as the main entrance. It has preferred Kotla to Upadhyay.

Canada revises family open work permits, may benefit thousands of IndiansCanada relaxes open work permit rules for spouses of international students and foreign workers starting January 21, 2025. Spouses of eligible students and workers in high-demand job sectors will be able to apply for an open work permit (OWP). Indian students, who make up a large portion of Canada's international student population, will benefit.

How BJP and Congress have given Kejriwal a free passDelhi Election: Despite over a decade to regroup, the BJP and Congress have failed to produce a leader who can challenge AAP convenor Arvind Kejriwal on his turf, Delhi. Now, weeks before the Assembly polls, with no credible leadership in sight, Kejriwal continues to capitalise on a vacuum left by the BJP and Congress, in his bid to retain power in Delhi.

Trump's pic with Coca-Cola CEO creates fizz, Diet Coke 'addict' Elon Musk reactsTrump, known for his love for Diet Coke, was pictured holding a commemorative bottle featuring a custom label reading 'Inauguration of President of the United States Donald J Trump'.

Meta may pause some WhatsApp features after India's antitrust data sharing banMeta, the parent company of WhatsApp, may have to roll back some features in India due to a recent antitrust ruling. Here are the details.

India smash record 435 vs Ireland, 4th-highest total in women's ODIs: StatsIndia vs Ireland, 3rd ODI: India smashed 435 in 50 overs to become only the third team to post more than 400 in an innings in women's ODIs. Smriti Mandhana and young Pratika Rawal hit a hundred each in Rajkot on Wednesday, January 15.

Woman opposes marriage, father shoots her with cops present outside homeA woman was shot dead by her father and cousin weeks before her marriage after she voiced opposition to marrying a man of the family's choice. A police team was present outside the woman's home where the crime took place.

Priyanka Chopra's mother Madhu wishes 'light of their lives' Malti on 3rd birthdayPriyanka Chopra's mother, Madhu shared a post to wish her granddaughter Malti Marie on her third birthday. Madhu shared a video featuring all the cute moments of the little one with her family.

When India's first Army chief KM Cariappa chose duty over familyOn Army Day, we honour Field Marshal KM Cariappa, India's first Army Chief, who refused special treatment for his captured son during the 1965 Indo-Pak war. His unyielding principles and leadership went on to shape the values of the Indian Army.

Actor Siddharth Nigam visits Maha Kumbh, takes a dip in Triveni Sangam Actor Siddharth Nigam visited Maha Kumbh Mela with his brother Abhishek Nigam and mother. He shared a post and expressed his profound experience.

Osaka was beaten by Muchova during the US Open last year.

Guardiola's animated chat with Ortega: City boss reveals what he told goalkeeperManchester City boss Pep Guardiola revealed what he told his goalkeeper Stefan Ortega after their draw against Brentford on Tuesday, January 14. Ortega was unable to prevent Brentford from scoring the equaliser in stoppage time.

Rishabh Pant leads 3-way battle for wicketkeeper slot in India squadChampions Trophy 2025: KL Rahul became India's preferred wicketkeeper in ODIs during Rishabh Pant's absence, but concerns over his ability to keep wickets for long periods arose after the 2023 World Cup. Pant's left-handed batting adds valuable variety to the middle order, making him a strong contender for India's first-choice keeper for the 50-over tournament.

Australian Open: Alcaraz asks if he is 'serve bot' after 14 aces vs NishiokaCarlos Alcaraz hilariously asked if he was a 'serve bot' after his incredible win over Japan's Yoshihito Nishioka in the second round of the Australian Open on Wednesday, January 15. Alcaraz served up a barrage of aces which stunned Nishioka in Melbourne.

R Ashwin breaks silence on retirement call, not getting farewell TestFormer India off-spinner R Ashwin said believed he was capable of representing India for a longer period than he ultimately did, but maintained his stance against farewell matches.

Hours after shock PSL retirement, Pakistan pacer Ihsanullah makes U-turnJust hours after making his shock retirement from the Pakistan Super League, pacer Ihsanullah has performed a U-turn. The 22-year-old said that he had made the call in the heat of the moment.

Australian Open: Olympic champion Zheng stunned, Mirra Andreeva survives scareThe Olympic champion and last year's runner-up, Zheng Qinwen, suffered a shock exit at the hands of Laura Siegemund on Day 4 of the Australian Open. Mirra Andreeva had to dig deep to overcome a scare by Japan's Moyuka Uchijima to progress to the third round.

Australian Open: Aryna Sabalenka survives 2nd set scare to beat Jessica Bouzas Defending champion Aryna Sabalenka survived an all-mighty scare in the second set to defeat a resolute Jessica Bouzas Maneiro to progress to the third round of the Australian Open 2025 on Wednesday, January 15.

Liverpool held to draw by Nottingham Forest, Manchester City let 2-goal lead slipLiverpool were forced to salvage a 1-1 draw against a resolute Nottingham Forest side, while Manchester City let a 2-0 lead slip to be held 2-2 draw by a determined Brentford on Tuesday, January 14 in the Premier League. Chelsea were able to secure a point against Bournemouth, while Graham Potter secured his first win as West Ham United manager.

Aakash Chopra questions India's T20 World Cup hero's absence in England seriesFormer India cricketer turned commentator, Aakash Chopra, has questioned the absence of India all-rounder Shivam Dube in the team for the upcoming T20I series against England.

Donyell Malen joins Aston Villa on permanent deal from Borussia DortmundAston Villa bolstered their attacking options by signing Dutch forward Donyell Malen from Borussia Dortmund for 23 million euros, with add-ons. Malen's experience and versatility are expected to strengthen Villa's push for European qualification and domestic success.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
